subject: Pedal Control Box Compatibility
description_text:
Simsonn Support,

A couple of months ago I purchased your Pro X pedals off of Amazon and like
them very much. Two weeks ago I ordered your VAM haptic feedback motors
with power supply and the newest version of your pedal control box made for
the Pro X Ultra pedals so that I could run the VAM motors. When I connected
everything, powered up the control box, and then went into the
Simsonn Manager software the pedals show as "disconnected" and cannot be
configured. I swapped back to my original control box and the pedals are
detected and work, but have no vibration. Right now I'm using version 2.0.5
of your manager software. Is there a firmware update that I need to do to
get this working?

Thanks!

James Wade

conversations.body_text: Hi J W,  Please download version 2.0.8 of the software and update to the latest firmware. Also, download version 9.9.3 of SimHub from the official website.  In the “Settings - Update” section, click “Manual Firmware Update,” then navigate to the pedals-firmware folder → pedals folder → and select the proxultra.sfu file to update. This firmware will disable the 4th axis.    https://www.simsonn.com/pages/download

What's the 4th axis and will it be supported in the future? The VAM and VAM
Pro support the same telemetry inputs and vibration outputs, correct?

PS: great customer support y'all!

On Wed, Jul 2, 2025, 7:38 PM service@simsonn.com

Hi J W,  The 4th axis is not in use and doesn’t need to be connected. The main difference between VAM and VAM Pro is that VAM Pro offers better support for vibration frequencies, providing a more refined feedback experience.
